MATH-AI

The 4th Workshop on Mathematical Reasoning and AI
(West Meeting Room 118-120, Vancouver, December 14, 2025, Website)

Schedule

8:25am - 8:30am Opening Remarks
8:30am - 9:00am Invited Talk: Dawn Song, UC Berkeley
9:00am - 9:30am Invited Talk: Samy Bengio, Apple
9:30am - 10:00am Invited Talk: Noam Brown, OpenAI
10:00am - 11:00am Panel Discussion: Dawn Song, Jeremy Avigad, Noam Brown, Junehyuk Jung (Brown)
11:00am - 12:30pm Coffee Break and Poster Session 1
12:30pm - 1:30pm Lunch Break
1:30pm - 2:00pm Invited Talk: Adam Wagner, Google DeepMind
2:00pm - 2:30pm Invited Talk: Jeremy Avigad, CMU
2:30pm - 3:00pm Coffee Break
3:00pm - 3:30pm Invited Talk: James Zou, Stanford
3:30pm - 4:00pm Contributed Talks:

1. VerMCTS: Synthesizing Multi-Step Programs using a Verifier, a Large Language Model, and Tree Search
David Brandfonbrener, Harvard University

2. Inference Scaling Laws: An Empirical Analysis of Compute-Optimal Inference for LLM Problem-Solving
Sean Welleck and Zhiqing Sun, CMU

3. Learning Mathematical Rules with Large Language Models
Nelson Vadori, JPMorganChase AI Research
4:00pm - 5:00pm Poster Session 2
5:00pm - 5:05pm Closing Remarks
